intro: Sisymbrium crassifolium var. laxiflorum, commonly known as the broad-leaved mustard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is part of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard plants. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Sisymbrium crassifolium var. laxiflorum is an annual herb that completes its life cycle within one growing season.
